explanation: Agent A's scenario correctly identifies a real potential Rule 21.17 violation. lfs_dir_getinfo calls lfs_dir_get with a requested length of (lfs->name_max + 1) and passes info->name whose storage is char name[LFS_NAME_MAX+1]. If at runtime lfs->name_max > LFS_NAME_MAX and there is no prior validation/clamping, the string/byte copy in lfs_dir_get (via memcpy/strcpy-like behavior) can write past info->name and thus violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17. The posted code does not show any check that lfs->name_max <= LFS_NAME_MAX, so the report is valid unless some other initialization/mount code (not shown) enforces that invariant. To be MISRA-compliant, the implementation must ensure lfs->name_max is never greater than LFS_NAME_MAX (or clamp the copy length), or otherwise guarantee no out-of-bounds access will occur.
